last_episode_to_air.name: The Final Fight
last_episode_to_air.overview: Jordan breaks news stories from the future, realizes that being on President Trump's team means supporting the "bad guys" and faces his enemies for one last fight.

name: The Opposition with Jordan Klepper
overview: A satire of the hyperbolic, conspiracy-laden noise machine that is the alternative-media landscape on both the right and left.

episodes.name: Kurt Andersen
episodes.overview: Jordan discusses the alternative media's unique viewpoints, introduces his team of Citizen Journalists and sits down with author Kurt Andersen.

episodes.name: Neal Katyal
episodes.overview: Jordan offers tips for reclaiming football, Aaron Jackson and Josh Sharp discuss what liberals don't get about humor, and attorney Neal Katyal talks about Trump's travel ban.

episodes.name: Ruth Marcus
episodes.overview: Jordan examines the results of the Alabama Senate primary, determines which numbers can be trusted and chats with journalist Ruth Marcus.

episodes.name: DeRay Mckesson
episodes.overview: Jordan gets a huge scoop about the Russian hacking scandal, dissects higher education with Citizen Journalist Kobi Libii and sits down with activist DeRay Mckesson.

episodes.name: Asha Rangappa
episodes.overview: Jordan dissects Tom Price's resignation, expands on Trump's Hurricane Maria efforts and discusses the Russian hacking scandal with national security expert Asha Rangappa.

episodes.name: Richard Painter
episodes.overview: Jordan offers tips on how to avoid discussing gun control, confronts former EPA administrator Gina McCarthy about climate change and chats with lawyer Richard Painter.

episodes.name: Michael Crowley
episodes.overview: Jordan calls out the FDA's heartless practices, predicts the outcome of President Trump's first space council meeting and chats with Politico correspondent Michael Crowley.

episodes.name: Jane Mayer
episodes.overview: Jordan honors the internet's brave truth-tellers, sends Citizen Journalists Josh Sharp and Aaron Jackson to the March for Racial Justice, and chats with author Jane Mayer.

episodes.name: David Litt
episodes.overview: Jordan recaps the Values Voter Summit, dissects Donald Trump's growing list of frenemies and sits down with former Obama speechwriter David Litt.

episodes.name: Bill Kristol
episodes.overview: Jordan reveals the truth about coal, sends Laura Grey to investigate Oklahoma's oil-funded school systems and chats with Weekly Standard editor at large Bill Kristol.

episodes.name: Nate Silver
episodes.overview: Jordan dissects Donald Trump's emoluments case, exposes Amazon's hold on small-town America and chats with FiveThirtyEight founder Nate Silver.

episodes.name: Carol Anderson
episodes.overview: Jordan introduces Steve Bannon's team of anti-establishment candidates, breaks down the Melania Trump body double conspiracy and sits down with author Carol Anderson.

episodes.name: Matt Taibbi
episodes.overview: Jordan celebrates the upcoming release of classified JFK files, sends Kobi Libii to infiltrate antifa and chats with author Matt Taibbi.

episodes.name: Bill Nye
episodes.overview: Jordan decodes a cryptic tweet from James Comey, breaks down EPA Chief Scott Pruitt's business approach to the environment and chats with legendary science guy Bill Nye.

episodes.name: Maura Healey
episodes.overview: Jordan discusses the DNC's alleged funding of the Trump-Russia dossier, spreads the word about gun-related threats and chats with Massachusetts Attorney General Maura Healey.

episodes.name: Bruce Bartlett
episodes.overview: Jordan dissects President Trump's tax reform plan, talks climate change with globalist Richard Branson and sits down with Bruce Bartlett, the author of "The Truth Matters."

episodes.name: Rob Reiner
episodes.overview: Jordan exposes the distracting news of Rick Gates and Paul Manafort's indictments, creates a safe space for powerful men to chat and sits down with "LBJ" director Rob Reiner.

episodes.name: Erin Gloria Ryan
episodes.overview: Jordan calls on the Citizen Journalists to tell scary stories, sends Laura Grey to investigate an anti-Trump coven and chats with Daily Beast editor Erin Gloria Ryan.

episodes.name: Clint Watts
episodes.overview: Jordan breaks down Congress's investigation into Russian-linked Facebook ads, compiles a list of America's worst enemies and sits down with security analyst Clint Watts.

episodes.name: Bassem Youssef
episodes.overview: Jordan defends President Trump's questionable remarks, consults Josh Sharp and Aaron Jackson about which leftist movies to avoid, and chats with comedian Bassem Youssef.

episodes.name: Nikole Hannah-Jones
episodes.overview: Jordan reacts to recent gun violence, praises Trump's Americanness abroad and talks to Nikole Hannah-Jones about school segregation.

episodes.name: David Daley
episodes.overview: Jordan discusses the future of Betsy DeVos's role as Secretary of Education, sends Citizen Journalist Tim Baltz to investigate voter fraud and chats with author David Daley.

episodes.name: Jon Lovett
episodes.overview: Jordan celebrates the anniversary of Donald Trump's presidential win, sings the praises of Donna Brazile and sits down with "Lovett or Leave It" host Jon Lovett.

episodes.name: Jen Psaki
episodes.overview: Jordan makes a harsh discovery about Trump's visit to China, uncovers Puerto Rico's plan to infiltrate swing states and chats with former White House staffer Jen Psaki.

episodes.name: Jose Calderon
episodes.overview: Jordan discusses the allegations against Roy Moore, checks in on the hurricane recovery effort in Puerto Rico and sits down with Hispanic Federation president Jose Calderon.

episodes.name: Jeff Ross
episodes.overview: Jordan examines Donald Trump Jr.'s supposed collusion with WikiLeaks, introduces a sale for his fellow freethinkers and talks immigration with Roastmaster General Jeff Ross.

episodes.name: Sarah Lacy
episodes.overview: Jordan breaks down Trump's judicial picks with Citizen Journalist Niccole Thurman, talks to a member of Trump's voter fraud commission and chats with author Sarah Lacy.

episodes.name: Molly Ball
episodes.overview: Jordan reunites with Jon Stewart, celebrates Thanksgiving with the Citizen Journalists and sits down with TIME magazine political correspondent Molly Ball.

episodes.name: Bill Browder
episodes.overview: Jordan gives President Trump the thanks he deserves, sends Citizen Journalist Tim Baltz to investigate sexism in Silicon Valley and chats with author Bill Browder.

episodes.name: D.L. Hughley
episodes.overview: Jordan takes a closer look at Project Veritas, ponders the shape of the Earth with Citizen Journalist Kobi Libii and sits down with "How Not to Get Shot" author D.L. Hughley.

episodes.name: Danica Roem
episodes.overview: Jordan addresses a nuclear threat to America, breaks down President Trump's plans to repeal net neutrality and sits down with Virginia Delegate-elect Danica Roem.

episodes.name: Paul Scheer
episodes.overview: Jordan enlists his team of Citizen Journalists to create campaign ads for Roy Moore, discovers the latest threat to Christmas and chats with comedian Paul Scheer.

episodes.name: Kwame Alexander
episodes.overview: Jordan celebrates the Republican tax plan victory, breaks down the proposed changes to concealed carry laws and sits down with poet Kwame Alexander.

episodes.name: Daniel Ellsberg
episodes.overview: Jordan honors the internet's brave truth-tellers, sends Citizen Journalists Josh Sharp and Aaron Jackson to the March for Racial Justice, and chats with author Jane Mayer.

episodes.name: Jennifer Egan
episodes.overview: Jordan unpacks the IOC's decision to ban Russia from the 2018 Winter Games, browses the Alt-Bible with Citizen Journalist Laura Grey and sits down with author Jennifer Egan.

episodes.name: Scott Kelly
episodes.overview: Jordan discusses Donald Trump Jr.'s genius courtroom tactics with Niccole Thurman, takes the #MAGAMealChallenge and sits down with astronaut Scott Kelly.

episodes.name: John Della Volpe
episodes.overview: Jordan defends Trump's soda habit, celebrates the rejection of fact-based smears against Roy Moore and talks with John Della Volpe about millennials' political futures.

episodes.name: Jessica Rosenworcel
episodes.overview: Jordan predicts the results of the Alabama Senate race, discusses the sexual misconduct allegations against Donald Trump and chats with FCC Commissioner Jessica Rosenworcel.

episodes.name: Chris Matthews
episodes.overview: Jordan finds a scapegoat for Roy Moore's loss in Alabama, visits Donald Trump's final rally of the year and sits down with MSNBC's Chris Matthews.

episodes.name: Lauren Duca
episodes.overview: Jordan describes the impact of voter suppression on the Trump family, looks back on the year's biggest stories and chats with Teen Vogue columnist Lauren Duca.

episodes.name: Natasha Bertrand
episodes.overview: Jordan honors American hero Guy Fieri, imagines the possibilities for a MAGA Football League with Tim Baltz and chats with journalist Natasha Bertrand.

episodes.name: Jeff Goodell
episodes.overview: Jordan breaks down President Trump and Steve Bannon's public feud, talks to Laura Grey about the U.S.'s mean girl tactics and sits down with author Jeff Goodell.

episodes.name: David Miliband
episodes.overview: David Miliband, President and CEO of the International Rescue Committee (IRC) and author of “RESCUE: Refugees and the Political Crisis of Our Time.”

episodes.name: Ty Segall
episodes.overview: Jordan warns of a liberal threat to President Trump in 2020 and appoints a special agent to take down Robert Mueller, and musician Ty Segall performs "My Lady's on Fire."

episodes.name: Brian Stelter
episodes.overview: Jordan reveals unverified dirt on Special Counsel Robert Mueller, sends Kobi Libii to investigate the Syrian refugee presence in Idaho and sits down with CNN's Brian Stelter.

episodes.name: Brian Klaas
episodes.overview: Jordan discovers the dangers of bipartisanship, sends Kobi Libii to Lee Stranahan's citizen journalism school and chats with "The Despot's Apprentice" author Brian Klaas.

episodes.name: Jelani Cobb
episodes.overview: Jordan warns of the dangers of the free press, learns the latest conservative trends from Niccole Thurman and Laura Grey, and chats with The New Yorker's Jelani Cobb.

episodes.name: Rob Riggle
episodes.overview: Jordan makes sense of President Trump's comments about Haitian and African immigrants, sheds light on the "raw water" trend and sits down with "12 Strong" star Rob Riggle.

episodes.name: Jessica Valenti
episodes.overview: Jordan uncovers President Trump's most boring political scandal, warns of the insidious war on men and chats with "Sex Object" author Jessica Valenti.

episodes.name: Matt Gertz
episodes.overview: Jordan sends Josh Sharp and Aaron Jackson to meet nominees for the Fake News Awards, learns a workout routine from Tim Baltz and chats with Media Matters fellow Matt Gertz.

episodes.name: David Cay Johnston
episodes.overview: Jordan learns about America's metaphorical border wall, sends Niccole Thurman to investigate artwork by Guantanamo Bay detainees and chats with author David Cay Johnston.

episodes.name: Jason Kander
episodes.overview: Jordan reveals the details of a secret government shutdown, explores Donald Trump's approach to female voters and sits down with Let America Vote president Jason Kander.

episodes.name: Vicente Fox
episodes.overview: Jordan runs down Hollywood's list of liberal Oscar nominees, discovers a solution for conservatives in California and chats with former Mexican President Vicente Fox.

episodes.name: Stephanie Schriock
episodes.overview: Jordan calls for an end to the gun violence debate, sends Kobi Libii to investigate Muslim extremists in Michigan and chats with EMILY's List president Stephanie Schriock.

episodes.name: Ted Lieu
episodes.overview: Jordan drafts a classified memo about the FBI, puts a new spin on politically correct words with Tim Baltz and sits down with Congressman Ted Lieu.

episodes.name: Roy Wood Jr.
episodes.overview: Jordan welcomes Sean Hannity to the fringe, dissects the decline of LGBTQ acceptance with Josh Sharp and Aaron Jackson and chats with This Is Not Happening host Roy Wood Jr.

episodes.name: Lauren Duca & Charlamagne tha God
episodes.overview: In this live post-State of the Union episode, Jordan clarifies Trump's message of unity, sends Kobi Libii to a boycott and sits down with Charlamagne Tha God and Lauren Duca.

episodes.name: Catherine Rampell
episodes.overview: Jordan weighs in on the left's plus-ones at the State of the Union, investigates the Department of Education and chats with The Washington Post's Catherine Rampell.

episodes.name: Michael Arceneaux
episodes.overview: Jordan examines Donald Trump's unfilled cabinet, passes holy judgment on public figures and chats with "I Can't Date Jesus" author Michael Arceneaux.

episodes.name: Ijeoma Oluo
episodes.overview: Jordan defends a controversial pickup truck ad, celebrates the Nunes memo and chats with author Ijeoma Oluo about her book “So You Want to Talk About Race.”

episodes.name: Adam Serwer
episodes.overview: Jordan adds new enemies to his list, frets over an alarming new version of Monopoly and sits down with The Atlantic's Adam Serwer.

episodes.name: Robin Thede
episodes.overview: Jordan defends President Trump's decision to have a military parade, discusses Black History Month with Kobi Libii and chats with "The Rundown" host Robin Thede.

episodes.name: Tarana Burke
episodes.overview: Jordan creates a manlier national anthem, sends Tim Baltz to interrogate former FBI official Frank Montoya Jr. and chats with founder of the #MeToo movement Tarana Burke.

episodes.overview: Marjory Stoneman Douglas High School students Carly Novell and Delaney Tarr, plus director Lacey Schwartz and author Mat Johnson.

episodes.name: Clint Smith
episodes.overview: Jordan unpacks the fringe media's theory about the Parkland mass shooting, grills former U.S. diplomats and sits down with author Clint Smith.

episodes.name: Ali Siddiq
episodes.overview: Jordan applauds NRA spokesperson Dana Loesch's historical expertise, discovers the Trumpian themes in "Black Panther" and sits down with comedian Ali Siddiq.

episodes.name: Baratunde Thurston
episodes.overview: Jordan discusses a major loss for NRA members and chats with "How to Be Black" author Baratunde Thurston, and Laura Grey talks to teen gun control advocates in Florida.

episodes.name: Wesley Lowery
episodes.overview: Jordan fantasizes about authoritarian rule in America, uncovers the narc trying to take down Alex Jones and sits down with The Washington Post's Wesley Lowery.

episodes.name: Anthea Butler
episodes.overview: Jordan praises Donald Trump's impeccable cabinet, breaks down the major changes happening in American culture and sits down with religious studies professor Anthea Butler.

episodes.name: Bakari Sellers
episodes.overview: Jordan heads to CPAC with Kobi Libii and Tim Baltz, chats with educators about Trump's plan to bring guns into the classroom and sits down with CNN's Bakari Sellers.

episodes.name: Nikki Glaser
episodes.overview: The Florida Senate walks back a ban on AR-15 rifles, Tim Baltz gets amped up for President Trump's trade war, and Nikki Glaser discusses her Comedy Central Radio show, You Up.

episodes.name: Cass Sunstein
episodes.overview: Jordan unpacks Sam Nunberg's media blitz, salutes lawmakers' righteous attempts to end gun violence and sits down with "Can It Happen Here?" author Cass Sunstein.

episodes.name: Christian Picciolini
episodes.overview: Jordan unveils a theory about President Trump's alter ego, gripes about online dating with Niccole Thurman and chats with "White American Youth" author Christian Picciolini.

episodes.overview: Jordan gets Tim Baltz's take on International Women's Day, sends Josh Sharp and Aaron Jackson on a mission in Kentucky and sits down with author Jesse Eisinger.

episodes.name: Jamali Maddix
episodes.overview: Jordan breaks down the MSM's attack on Betsy DeVos, ponders what's wrong with America's youth and sits down with "Hate Thy Neighbor" host Jamali Maddix.

episodes.name: Tom Nichols
episodes.overview: Jordan celebrates the House Intelligence Committee's Russian collusion verdict, learns the fundamentals of conservative comedy and chats with author Tom Nichols.

episodes.name: Maya Wiley
episodes.overview: Jordan breaks down the Pennsylvania special election results, introduces an alternative to government-funded education and sits down with Professor Maya Wiley.

episodes.name: Andrew Marantz
episodes.overview: Jordan exposes CNN anchor Chris Cuomo's illicit breakfast behavior, sits down with former Trump advisor Carter Page and chats with the New Yorker's Andrew Marantz.

episodes.name: Julia Ioffe
episodes.overview: Jordan marvels at Russia's impressive election results, warns Americans about the dangerous war on men and chats with Atlantic contributor Julia Ioffe.

episodes.name: of Montreal
episodes.overview: Jordan discusses President Trump's strategy for solving America's opioid crisis, Kobi Libii investigates an online conspiracy and of Montreal performs "Soft Music."

episodes.name: Kate Folmar
episodes.overview: Jordan questions who's really behind the March for Our Lives protests, reveals what the left doesn't know about guns and chats with Everytown for Gun Safety's Kate Folmar.

episodes.name: Cory Booker
episodes.overview: Jordan talks to the organizers of DC Teens Action, sends Kobi Libii to meet with a group of Baltimore students protesting gun violence and chats with Senator Cory Booker.

episodes.name: Michael Ian Black
episodes.overview: Jordan confronts teens at the March For Our Lives, finds out how Trump's base feels about his alleged affair with Stormy Daniels and chats with comedian Michael Ian Black.

episodes.name: Amy Siskind
episodes.overview: Jordan warns of the possibility of space debris falling to Earth, passes holy judgment on public figures and chats with "The List" author Amy Siskind.

episodes.name: Kay Cannon
episodes.overview: Jordan suggests innocuous questions to add to the 2020 census, gives props to Fox News host Jeanine Pirro and chats with "Blockers" director Kay Cannon.

episodes.name: Alan Dershowitz
episodes.overview: Jordan salutes the defenders of the Second Amendment, leads a gun-friendly yoga class and sits down with attorney Alan Dershowitz.

episodes.name: Aparna Nancherla
episodes.overview: Jordan breaks down President Trump's relationship with Fox News, sends Niccole Thurman to investigate drag queen storytellers and sits down with comedian Aparna Nancherla.

episodes.name: Gregory T. Angelo
episodes.overview: Jordan warns America about the FBI's attacks, offers Mark Zuckerberg tips for his congressional hearing and chats with Log Cabin Republicans President Gregory T. Angelo.

episodes.name: Alan Dershowitz & Sally Kohn
episodes.overview: Jordan breaks the shocking news about Paul Ryan's spinelessness, dines with attorney Alan Dershowitz and sits down with "The Opposite of Hate" author Sally Kohn.

episodes.name: Bari A. Williams
episodes.overview: Jordan breaks down Scott Pruitt's EPA challenge coin redesign, sends Kobi Libii to confront a crisis actor posing as Alex Jones and chats with tech exec Bari A. Williams.

episodes.name: Rick Tyler
episodes.overview: Jordan dissects Infowars host Alex Jones's emotional reaction to Trump's Syrian missile strike, ponders America's ongoing changes and chats with MSNBC's Rick Tyler.

episodes.name: David Corn & Michael Isikoff
episodes.overview: Jordan reveals Sean Hannity's ties to Michael Cohen, Tim Baltz dives into a conservative punk movement, and authors David Corn and Michael Isikoff discuss "Russian Roulette."

episodes.name: Alicia Menendez
episodes.overview: Jordan puts the blame for recent political blunders on Nikki Haley, gets to know conservative YouTube dynamos Diamond and Silk, and chats with Bustle's Alicia Menendez.

episodes.overview: Josh Sharp and Aaron Jackson investigate global warming, Jordan takes calls from fans seeking advice, and Jay Chandrasekhar and Steve Lemme talk "Super Troopers 2."

episodes.name: Ross Douthat
episodes.overview: Jordan and Kobi Libii wrongly assume that the hero of a shooting in Nashville was armed, the war on men continues, and author Ross Douthat talks "To Change the Church."

episodes.name: Justin Simien
episodes.overview: Jordan welcomes Kanye West to the right, honors the brave defenders of the Second Amendment and chats with "Dear White People" director Justin Simien.

episodes.name: Annie Waldman
episodes.overview: Jordan offers career advice to White House physician Ronny Jackson, makes a plea to Hillary Clinton on behalf of Republicans and chats with ProPublica reporter Annie Waldman.

episodes.name: Adam Pally
episodes.overview: Jordan dissects President Trump's "Fox & Friends" interview, Niccole Thurman meets the teens running for governor of Kansas, and Adam Pally discusses "Most Likely to Murder."

episodes.name: Cecile Richards
episodes.overview: Jordan praises Donald Trump's insult diplomacy, Josh Sharp and Aaron Jackson attend a Trump rally in Michigan, and Planned Parenthood's Cecile Richards talks “Make Trouble.”

episodes.name: Garry Kasparov
episodes.overview: Jordan dissects Robert Mueller's questions for President Trump, breaks down the Trump administration's divine plans for sex education and chats with Garry Kasparov.

episodes.name: Cenk Uygur
episodes.overview: Jordan introduces West Virginia’s fringe candidate Don Blankenship, recognizes MAGA-ism as a religion and sits down with Armenian Genocide denier and host of “The Young Turks” Cenk Uygur.

episodes.name: Ron Livingston
episodes.overview: Jordan sheds light on Rudy Giuliani's legal expertise, Josh Sharp and Aaron Jackson bring conservatism back to the Boy Scouts of America, and Ron Livingston discusses "Tully."

episodes.name: Jonah Goldberg
episodes.overview: Jordan gives Devin Nunes advice, Tim Baltz meets with former Consumer Financial Protection Bureau Director Richard Cordray, and Jonah Goldberg discusses "Suicide of the West."

episodes.name: Mark and Jay Duplass
episodes.overview: Jordan prepares for Trump's showdown with Robert Mueller, Laura Grey and Niccole Thurman investigate an island for women, and Mark and Jay Duplass discuss "Like Brothers."

episodes.name: Nell Scovell
episodes.overview: Jordan dissects President Trump's Iran deal decision, Laura Grey tries to reach teachers protesting in Colorado, and Nell Scovell discusses “Just the Funny Parts.”

episodes.name: Amy Chozick
episodes.overview: Jordan finds a handsome new lawyer for President Trump, Josh Sharp and Aaron Jackson critique the liberal summer movie sequels, and Amy Chozick discusses “Chasing Hillary.”

episodes.name: Anthony Scaramucci
episodes.overview: Jordan praises President Trump for keeping his promises, breaks down America's immigration policy and chats with former White House Communications Director Anthony Scaramucci.

episodes.name: Jonathan Capehart
episodes.overview: Jordan addresses North Carolina's congressional diversity concerns, helps Tim Baltz fix President Trump's problems and chats with The Washington Post's Jonathan Capehart.

episodes.name: Lizz Winstead
episodes.overview: Writer, Producer & Comicordan breaks down the boring details of the British royal wedding, gripes about the latest changes in America and chats with Lady Parts Justice League founder Lizz Winstead.

episodes.overview: Jordan uses his gaslight to shed light on Trump's immigration policy, answers questions from callers with Tim Baltz and chats with "The Fourth Estate" director Liz Garbus.

episodes.overview: Jordan breaks down Ted Cruz's questionable campaign tactics, gets to know the latest freethinkers running for office and chats with "Raw" author Lamont “U-God” Hawkins.

episodes.name: Bernie Sanders
episodes.overview: Establishment shill Senator Bernie Sanders (Ind-Vt.).

episodes.overview: Jordan discusses Trump's canceled Philadelphia Eagles celebration, sends Kobi Libii to investigate the sanctuary movement and chats with The New York Times's Sheri Fink.

episodes.overview: Jordan weighs in on the NRA's loyalty questionnaire, finds a new way to grant clemency to low-level offenders and chats with The Daily Beast's Will Sommer.

episodes.overview: Jordan savors Trump's historic peace summit win, commissions a piece of art for the president's birthday and chats with comedian Hari Kondabolu.

episodes.name: Clint Watts
episodes.overview: Jordan salutes the latest freethinkers running for office, helps America understand who Michael Cohen really is and chats with "Messing with the Enemy" author Clint Watts.

episodes.name: Dan Pfeiffer
episodes.overview: Jordan breaks down President Trump's zero-tolerance immigration policy, Laura Grey chats with Senator Jeff Merkley, and Dan Pfeiffer discusses "Yes We (Still) Can."

episodes.name: Yeonmi Park
episodes.overview: Jordan questions his trust in Fox News, answers questions from callers with Kobi Libii and sits down with human rights activist and "In Order to Live" author Yeonmi Park.

episodes.overview: Jordan adds new foes to his lengthy list of enemies, Josh Sharp and Aaron Jackson take down everything in their path, and Karamo Brown discusses "Queer Eye."

episodes.name: Cameron Esposito
episodes.overview: Jordan recognizes America's small-town heroes, applauds Fox News pundit Jeanine Pirro's support for President Trump and sits down with comedian Cameron Esposito.

episodes.name: Richard Painter
episodes.overview: Jordan questions the future of civil discourse, grapples with the ongoing changes in America and sits down with former White House ethics lawyer Richard Painter.

episodes.name: Lauren Duca
episodes.overview: Jordan questions President Trump's honesty, sends Laura Grey and Niccole Thurman to investigate Mississippi's sole abortion clinic and chats with Teen Vogue's Lauren Duca.

episodes.name: Kim Gordon
episodes.overview: Jordan sells products to help freethinkers fight the MSM without him, finds out why Niccole Thurman is leaving the Trump train and chats with musician and actress Kim Gordon.

episodes.name: The Final Fight
episodes.overview: Jordan breaks news stories from the future, realizes that being on President Trump's team means supporting the "bad guys" and faces his enemies for one last fight.
